remarks: The supremum of a bounded set of real numbers is the least upper bound. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-May-2019.)
statement:
supicc.1 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
supicc.2 $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR ) $.
supicc.3 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ ( B [,] C ) ) $.
supicc.4 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= (/) ) $.
supiccub.1 $e |- ( ph -> D e. A ) $.
supicclub2.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. A ) -> z <_ D ) $.
supicclub2 $p |- ( ph -> sup ( A , RR , < ) <_ D ) $.
$d A z $.
$d D z $.
$d ph z $.
